title: Senior Creative Project Manager
content:
Media.Monks is a digital-first marketing and advertising services company connecting the dots across content, data & digital media and technology services. Inspired by the connectivity and flexibility of technology APIs, Media.Monks’ single-P&L model offers brands seamless access to a nearly 6,000-strong team of digital talent organized across 57 talent hubs in 33 countries. 
With us, you'll find a diverse group of colleagues with different backgrounds and perspectives. We believe everyone has something of value to offer, and that sustaining a truly diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace begins with fostering an environment where people can be themselves, authentically, every day. We want to build something with the potential to change the heart of our industry, and we’d love to include your unique perspective.
Now, about the opportunity: We’re looking to hire a versatile Senior Creative Project Manager to help execute and manage the production of various creative projects from kick-off to launch. Projects consist primarily of digital out of home, video, and social assets using specific templates, with some occasional reporting and presentations. You will serve as the main point of contact with our US-based team, and be responsible for managing and regularly updating project status and key details, while keeping things moving with the local teams. Regular client communication is also necessary.
This role requires excellent communication and organizational skills, extreme attention to detail, a sense of urgency when responding to queries and while problem solving, as well as experience in managing projects, video production, and/or producing digital content in an advertising agency or equivalent. An intimate understanding of what is needed to run a successful project from start to finish is key. The goal of your team is to be nimble and reactive while producing a high volume of output following an established process each week. 
If you’re keen to work as a part of a nimble team that focuses on creating effective digital content with quick turnarounds, this job represents a great opportunity.
The role is based in Sao Paulo, Brazil. You will work with other team members based in Buenos Aires, Argentina, and in the United States. 
Role & Responsibilities:

Serve as the primary point of contact for clients and project execution team. You will be the main point of contact with our US-based team and also guide the creative team to deliver high-quality work on time each week. 
Collaborate closely with account and creative teams to oversee creative production for a high volume of templated digital projects and campaigns each week. Projects include weekly digital out of home campaigns for new music releases and follow an established process. Lead the production and manage day-to-day communications with the account, creative, and client marketing teams via email, chat, and video conference calls. Attend and participate in weekly meetings with clients and internal teams. Request creative resources each week as needed.
Create, update, and maintain project timelines and other related documentation, and provide regular project updates to clients and team members.
Build and maintain key relationships with client teams and internal discipline leads.
Manage all project-related details and communications from start to finish. Be in charge of asset management, share feedback, and respond to requests and project updates in a timely manner.


May occasionally liaise with regional teams on scaled global campaigns, help run projects requiring localization of creative assets, and help traffic final assets.

 
Requirements: 

3-5 years of experience working as a digital project manager or video/content producer in an advertising agency or video production house.
Knowledge of the creative process, or willingness to learn quickly. Ability to create and enforce project timelines.
You are able to remain calm in a fast-paced environment and work under tight deadlines. You can be flexible and adapt to changing priorities. 
You know how to communicate effectively with account leads, creative teams, as well as directly with clients. This includes providing project status updates, giving feedback, and negotiating.
Superb planning, organizational, and communication skills (written and verbal) with extreme attention to detail. 
Fluent/advanced level of written and spoken English.
Team player who can successfully work across teams, time zones, and technologies.
Familiarity with Google Suite and Wrike or other project management tool.
Able to work independently with minimal supervision, ask questions and flag potential issues as they arise, mitigate risk, and offer creative solutions to problems. 
Be solution-oriented and have a humble attitude—No egos here!

#LI-HybridAbout Media.Monks:
Media.Monks is the purely digital operating brand of S4Capital plc that connects 8,600+ digital natives across one global team. We are united by a mission to shift industries forward and pave the path towards ambitious outcomes so our clients and our people can realize their full potential for growth. Our unified model combines solutions in media, data, social, platforms, studio, experience, brand and technology services to help our clients continuously reinvent themselves throughout increasingly rapid cycles of disruption. Our efforts to shape culture, build innovative technologies and unlock the future of growth have earned recognition from numerous esteemed panels: we maintain a constant presence on Adweek’s Fastest Growing lists (2019-22), regular recognition at Cannes Lions, inclusion in AdExchanger’s Programmatic Power Players (2020-23), the title of Webby Production Company of the Year (2021-23), a record number of FWAs, and have earned a spot on Newsweek’s Top 100 Global Most Loved Workplaces 2023. Together, these achievements solidify our experience in digital innovation, excellence in craft, and commitment to personal growth.
While we continue to grow our teams, please be mindful of fraudulent job postings and recruiting activities that may use our company name and information. Please be mindful to protect your personal information, especially your national identification number, and bank account information during a recruiting process. While Media.Monks may reach out to potential candidates via LinkedIn, we will always ask applicants to apply through our website (https://media.monks.com/careers) and will never ask for payment or bank account information during the recruitment process.

At Media.Monks, we believe in fostering an environment where a diversity of perspectives can thrive. We proactively work to design hiring processes that promote equity and inclusion while mitigating bias. We celebrate diversity and are committed to building a team that reflects the communities we serve. We welcome and encourage qualified applicants, from all backgrounds, who are excited to contribute to our mission. 

As a step in strengthening our hiring process, we invite you to voluntarily provide information that will help inform and improve our inclusion efforts.

As a reminder, answering this question is entirely voluntary. Your response will remain confidential and intended solely for the purpose of improving our hiring process; and will not, in any way, be associated with your specific application or be used in the hiring decision.
